description: Best app to read books and pdfs...

Very simplistic, and easy to use and load. There's one minor bug, whenever I open the search option to find a word, the bar does not go away after I have done searching and stays there indefinetely and I have to restart the application to remove the search bar from the Top.
summary: It's good, simple and not over complicated when using for PDF

description: I use a 2 in 1 device and I'll be glad if there's support for pen to take notes.
summary: Great app, but pen tools would be awesome

description: First of all, in my usecase this works perfectly. I only need to read pdf files and make notations on the files, for myself. And this works perfectly.
summary: I like the notations in the PDF

description:
Great app. Never had any issue.

Solid for several years.

Thanks devs !
Opens my documents just fine, but the "find in page" function is often not able to find phrases that I KNOW are in the document. Also has troubles finding non latin letters like Æ Ø Å.
Basic features missing and still got no libadwaita support in gnome 46.
Generally a good program, but v3.28.4 sometimes doesn't print everything in your documents. This is really risky when printing out tax forms as I learned....
summary: Sometimes has missing info in printed files

description:
Although this will let you add text to a form it will not give you any option to add or import or insert or draw a signature making the software completly useless. 

Honestly the Linux community needs a solid PDF document handler that does everything. Now 30 different types of programs that only do small portions of a task. 

Also please just give this app it's proper name. It's full name is Evince Document Viewer.

Using it daily. Easily the best document viewer out there. UI is pretty uncluttered, but everything you'd expect from a document viewer is there -- full screen presentation and continuous reading modes, inverse colors for night reading.

Format support is excellent -- renders virtually every PDF and PS file correctly.
Sometimes can not open,but it's opened
It works correctly, I am satisfied.
summary: Works very good, very helpful application

description: It's my favorite document viewer! It has a nice look, it's lightweight and very functional.
Highlighter, markup, and stickies for tablet notes in a lecture environment.
summary: runs perfect, no complaints, free suggestion.

description: Unable to zoom in/zoom out by shortcut or by preference under Fedora 25.
I used it on fedora 20 and 23 and it has always been a great app. But now on f25 the zoom doesn't work and I really need that feature.
Evince is indeed a simple and an easy to use universal document viewer with the right amount of most used features. I wish though if Evince gains epub viewing capability.
summary: A very good documents viewer for GNOME

description: I've found myself impressed by this reader! I can read all my comics and occasionally some pdf. I like the options and how it works, really appreciate it
There are some bugs and weakness when utilize note and some similar graphical effect. I removed it when it crashed repeatedly for a simple removal of highlighting.
Saves the last page read, restore it in the next session. Good navigation and ability to bookmark. I use it on windows as well as Linux.

Don't expect even rudimentary editing capabilities available in other PDF viewers. It really does just let you view the document, and only that. You can print, fill in pre-existing forms, and scroll between pages, and that's about it.
summary: Disappointing, but does what it says

description:
This is one of a growing number of applications that for some reason seem to lack a menu/title bar, making them a pain to use.
Apart from that: The Linux PDF viewer landscape is a disaster (like with picture viewers, media players, text editors, etc.). No single application comes close to delivering the combination of GUI looks, usability, functionality, stability that makes a "winner" or is even close to what can be reasonably expected.
This one seems to be the least dysfunctional of the bunch though, so it's the one I keep using.
Occasional reading is OK via this application. However, more advanced features, especially annotation, isn't as effective and efficient.

When I click on links to specific chapters in a 60-page PDF file, focus is switched to my file manager, and I get the "busy" cursor as if the file manager is searching for a file.

I'm not absolutely certain this is a bug within this app. Maybe it's a Gnome 3 issue. I'm running Debian 9 with Gnome 3.
summary: Doesn't appear to handle anchor links in documents properly

description: Excellent, I would love to see new features in it, for example, being able to export all the highlighted lines or texts in pdf or all the comments and it does not allow signing pdfs, to have pdf passwords and more options to highlighted with other colors or export an important section of a document.
summary: Excellent but can have new functions yet

description: A decent PDf viewer should be able to annotate a PDF document with text fields.
summary: Can't fill out / add text fields to PDF

description: I've used quite a few pdf readers, and this one just works. What else can you ask for?
summary: Never had any problems with this one

description: It would be better to add some more functions
summary: It's just a PDF viewer that could only add some highlights&comments

description: splits the document in half when pressing some unknown keyboard commands, This is not revertable ( neccecary to rename the document ) so makes it almost impossible to edit pdf files.
it has all the basic features, and it's lite
Does what it needs to do without any fuss and quickly too. Nice simple interface and no bloat as it doesn't try to do everything. A really good example of good programming!
I just found that it's better than xpdf, which is expected to behave better.

Fast with heavy long documents, low power consumption, doesn't crash... Perfect.

Would like more reading backgrounds for epub etc. like a powerful eReader and editing options like Calibre
crashed after few days
I have been using this app for several months, its is pretty good and it is smooth on scrolling, clear text, book marks, recent items.... I love it.
It just works. PDF, DJVU, CBR, CBZ you name it. Unlike windows, we don't need an application for each file format.
Ctrl+H = Highlight selected text. It's a very basic and easy implementation. What's taking you so long to add it?
summary: Why don't we have highlight hotkey

description: evince is so lovely. Annotation made it even sweeter

it was possible to resize the left bookmark pane, now it os no longer possible!

Rarely used this program, and when I really needed it the program would freeze half way through opening the document. Tried multiple times. After trial running 2 other programs I found Okuler which worked perfect.

It is a good pdf viewer. But should have more functionalities like dark mode, support more file types like djvu, chm or mobi etc.
All basic functionalities are good. I like it, but it should be universal document viewer. For some types, I shouldn't have to install some other software.
summary: Good pdf viewer, but should have more functionality

superfast and great useful features

really good und stable programm.

it has every function I want and don't have any disadvantage I don't want.

Evince has everything for me to view PDF documents, many thanks.

So lite, so usefull

Works with everything I've used it for. Reading mostly company reports and financial statements in PDF. Works great.
When I want to slide to next page, this application will slide two pages.

2) the inversion function really messes up the details of images

Useless. Prints without unicode symbols.
It doesn't have a lot of features, but for opening and viewing a document quickly, it's awesome.

summary: works great but prints too dark, despite calibration

description:
...because it supports rudimentary touchpad gestures. Can you believe that finding a pdf viewer that supports pinch to zoom is nearly impossible on linux in 2020?

Having said that, could use many improvements:

1. Better annotation options; highlight and note is too rudimentary (give us underline, rectangle etc)
2. Option to load document to RAM (like Okular) to make large documents fast.

description: great app! really works well.,

It does the job for me.

It's very simple and light, does everything nicely
Its very simplified renders quite well and haven't had any problems with it. So far so good
summary: Best pdf reader i've ever used

description: Guter PDF Betrachter

Evince lief erst gut (V. 3.30.1), dann plötzlich stellt es den Dienst ein (nach miktex Installation? "Speicherzugriffsfehler" ohne weitere Details). Im Internet Hinweis auf Programmbug, kein Anhalt für Fehler im System (Dateirechte oder fehlende Dateien, etc.). Seltsam. Deinstalliert (purge, autoremove), reinstalliert - geht nicht, deinstalliert, SNAP-Version (3.34.2) installiert und in /usr/bin verlinkt - geht wieder. Hallo?
Bringt meinen Laptop zum abstürzen wenn ich Bilder betrachten will.
Nicht mehr vorhandene Dokumente kann man nicht Mal manuell entfernen. Sie bleiben als Dateileiche sichtbar. Das macht die App zumindest für mich unbrauchbar, da völlig unübersichtlich.
schlecht aber trotzdem da
Funktioniert scheinbar, hoffe das bleibt laut den anderen Bewertungen auch so.
Ein handelsüblicher Dokumentenbetrachter

Wurde wohl mit dem letzten Update installiert, und hat sich automatisch als Standard für PDFs und sonstiges festgelegt. Genau so sollte es unter Linux doch NICHT laufen, lasst den "Müll per Update" Kram doch lieber mal bei Windows
DIe Anwendung hat mir schon diverse dokumente nicht korrekt angezeigt. Anhand eines aktuellen dokumentes kann ich zummindest sicher sagen, dass diese Version keine Formularinhalte anzeigen kann.
Beim Doppelklick auf ein PDF wird der Dokumentbetrachter gestartet, jedoch ist kein Fenster sichtbar! Der Atril-Dokumentenbetrachter kann dieses PDF jedoch ohne weiteres darstellen.
summary: Zeigt häufig PDF nicht an - daher für mich unbrauchbar

description: Läuft seit Jahren auf unterschiedlichen Rechnern sehr verlässlich

Funktioniert als PDF-Betrachter sehr gut und zuverlässig. Ist nicht so leichtgewichtig wie andere PDF-Apps, hat dafür aber ein paar schöne Features und ein sehr gelungenes Design. Pluspunkt für die Erweiterungen, mtit denen man ePS, DejaVu etc. nachrüsten kann.
Leider ist der Umgang mit und die Darstellung von Kommentaren nicht so elegant wie bei Okular oder Acrobat Reader. Wie die meisten freien PDF-Reader kann man PDF-Dateien mit Evince nicht trivial unterschreiben, das ist heutzutage nicht toll. Auch die eingebetteten Tools/Macros, die manche Acrobat-Workflows haben, funktionieren mit Evince nicht.
Evince ist vielleicht nicht besonders effizient zu bedienen, aber es kann trotzdem alles, was ich von einem PDF-Betrachter erwarten würde und es sieht sehr schick aus.
Sponageprogramm für Ubuntu
simplel Programm das zu dumm ist um sich MAXIMIERT dauerhaft zu merken.

L'application est basique mais ne bug pas (du moins pour moi) mais j'aimerais que l'on puisse pouvoir éditer les documents et pas juste les visualiser . J'ai beaucoup de documents pdf a éditer et je suis obligé de passer par LibreOffice draw qui n'est pas fait pour ça et qui a par conséquent quelques bugs. 
J'aimerais bien que cette application aille un peu plus loin en offrant la possibilités d'éditer les pdf (un peu comme le visionneur de documents de MacOS).
Style épuré, simple d'utilisation et suffisamment complet. Je l'utilise tous les jours et je n'ai jamais rencontrer de bugs.

L'application fonctionne bien, de manière stable, pour la lecture de documents PDF.
En revanche, il arrive que l'impression ne fonctionne plus (impression instable).

Простая и удобная читалка. Очень не хватает чего-то подобного на других операционных системах.
Очень приятный интерфейс. Конкурентов для чтения нет.

Использовал только как прогу для открытия пдф и изредка djvu и их последующей печати. Для этого абсолютно подходящая прога, так как быстро работает, запоминает на каком месте закрыл. Так еще есть и ночной режим.
В новой Ubuntu 22.04 любимый просмотровщик перестал запоминать настройки и собственно место, где я закончил читать.
хочу попробовать
Это единственный ридер который понимает все нужные мне форматы и самый хорошо реализованнный ридер
В принципе, всё, что требуется от просмотрщика документов, имеется.

Особенно мне нравится:
1. Минималистичность - интерфейс не выесняет страницы документов на второй план
2. Удобство навигации - показывает во всплывающем окне часть документа, на которую ссылается внутренняя ссылка
3. Поиск - вернее представление результатов
классное и удобное приложение, удобно читать pdf файлы

Приложение лаконичное и справляется с базовыми функциями просмотра pdf и djvu документов, другими не пользуюсь. Но, очень не хватает: изменения ориентации и порядка следования страниц; добавления новых страниц; ручки или фломастера для подчеркивания и рукописного комментирования страниц; добавления текста и геометрических фигур; сборки pdf из набора фотографий или сканов . Если добавить перечисленные функции, приложение будет безальтернативное.
